pr_title: client session manager: fix shutdown race deleting a null session

timeline.message:
Preventing ClientSessionManager from calling onClinetShutdown
multiple times.

Preventing ClientSessionManager from calling onClinetShutdown
multiple times.

Keep from calling onClientShutdown with null sessionId

Calling onClientShutdown twice will always have a null session ID and so
will throw a null pointer exception. Adding a check to the beginning of
onClientShutdown to return early if sessionId is null.

timeline.bodyText: this null check should be down next to the delete call
timeline.author: Adam-

timeline.message:
Keep from calling onClientShutdown with null sessionId

Calling onClientShutdown twice will always have a null session ID and so
will throw a null pointer exception. Adding a check to the beginning of
onClientShutdown to return early if sessionId is null.

timeline.bodyText: There are potentially ~3 threads here (event, which comes in on EDT?), this thread, and the thread executing ping, so this is not thread safe. You should make a local reference to sessionId and then use that.
timeline.author: Adam-

replies.bodyText: Good catch, I hadn't thought of the threaded nature of this.
replies.author: Doxterpepper
